bibl.title: Letter from Carlos E. Finlay to Philip Showalter Hench, September 5, 1940

div1.p: Finlay is unsure about the location of Camp Lazear. His book on his father, Carlos J. Finlay, has been published, and he cites references in it to Agramonte, Lazear, and Reed.

div1.head: Letter from Carlos E. Finlay to Philip Showalter Hench, September 5, 1940
div1.opener:
DR. C. E. FINLAY
LINEA NUMERO 710
TELEFONO F-4730
VEDADO, HABANA
CUBA
September 5 1940
My dear Dr Hench
div1.p: I received your letter of August 26

I am afraid that my evidence on the primitive
location of Camp Lazear is not very reliable as
the topography of Marianao has changed since. The only
reliable opinion on the subject I think is that of
Dr Angles who has lived for years in Merianao and aided
in the experiments. My father surely visited the camp
but I don't remember his remarks on its topography
and my impression that the location of the camp as at
present pointed out us wrong is merely and impression

My book on my father's work is finished and I have
received the first copy from the editors if you write
to the Oxford University Pres 114 Fifth Avenue New York
you can get a copy in few days, as they hold the copyright

In it my fahther's views are thoroughly treshed out.
Dr Reed's Letter to my father is on page 98. On page
222 you will find a letter of Agramonte to my father
in which reference is made of two hitherto unpublished
of Lazear which I think should interest you
Many thanks for the enclosed photo
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours C.E. Finlay There is a faint possibility of my being in
Washington at the time of youy addrees
